page.title: 04RELIGION IN LLANBISTER
page.content: There are two places of worship in Llanbister village."St.Cynllo's the Parish Church and the Methodist Chapel,both of which are situated about 1000ft above sea-level. The Parish Church is a 13th century building,it is one of a group of four churches which are in the charge of a priest who lives in the next viiage four miles away.Membership of the church is about 34 with an average congregation of 14.Services are held every Sunday at 11am.Its denomination is Church in Wales. In contrast the Methodist Chapel is only 149 years old,this belongs to a group of 10 chapels with the Minister residing in Kington.Membership of the chapel is about 11 with an average congregation of 8.Services are held every sunday at 6.30pm.The service is sometimes taken by a Lay-Preacher.
